titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Lee Snider Photograph Collection
ca. 1977-2009
MSS 248
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ashley Todd, 2009; Brent Phillips, 2009

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-12-17T15:43-0500

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: The Lee Snider Photograph Collection is comprised of black and white prints, color slides, and photo cds documenting AIDS activism and Gay Pride, primarily in New York City, from 1977 through 2009.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Lee Snider Photograph Collection; MSS 248; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Each Series is arranged chronologically by event, when possible, based on information provided by the creator. Each event is separated by a piece of paper stating a brief description of the event and its date. Unspecified events are filed chronologically by their date. In the instance that only a general date is provided, the event is filed at the end of that time period. All undated and unidentified pieces are located in an "unidentified" file at the end of the series.

list.item: Series I: Black and White Prints

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Lee Snider has been a successful photographer for over three decades. His work has appeared in major magazines, newspapers, and in countless books, calendars, and other forms of editorial media. His photography is represented by four major photo stock agencies, Corbis Images, The Image Works, Veer Marketplace and Dreamstime, and he has an impressive photo library of over 1,000,000 images taken in Asia, Canada, Europe, and the United States. His business associate and partner is the Chinese photographer Mr. Xu Lei of Sichuan Province.

As part of his photo-journalism work, Lee has covered many New York City events that have transpired in the history of the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender community since 1977, when he first became a professional photographer.
